definition: constellation (arch., now 星座)/one of the 28 constellations of traditional Chinese astronomy and astrology/motion of stars since one's birth (predetermining one's fate in astrology)
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
constellation
lodge for the night/old/former
night/classifier for nights
surname Su
Xingxiuhai, high plateau in Qinhai close to the source of the Yellow River

sentences.english: He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.
sentences.chinese: 他數點星宿的數目，一一稱它的名。

sentences.english: He telleth the number of the stars;
sentences.chinese: 他數點星宿的數目，一一稱它的名。

sentences.english: And he set them in the firmament of heaven to shine upon the earth.
sentences.chinese: 天主將星宿擺列在天空，照耀大地。

sentences.english: She judge direction according to the constellation and give an astronomy lecture to us.
sentences.chinese: 她根據星宿判斷航向，給我們開了一次天文學講座。

sentences.english: The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy endureth for ever.
sentences.chinese: 他造月亮星宿管黑夜，因他的慈愛永遠長存。

sentences.english: Human consensus believes that the Pleiades exists and so it is.
sentences.chinese: 人類羣體相信昴星宿的存在，所以它存在。

sentences.english: Lights from hurricane lamps flickering about in the pine forest created the scene of a star-studded sky.
sentences.chinese: 松林中射來零亂的風燈，都成了滿天星宿。

sentences.english: According to the Hindu calendar, each year is ruled by a particular planet.
sentences.chinese: 根據印度曆書，每一年都由某一特定的星宿管轄。

sentences.english: Peoples, like planets, possess the right to an eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 人民和星宿一樣，有權暫時隱沒。

sentences.english: He determines the number of the stars and calls them each by name.
sentences.chinese: 他數點星宿的數目，一一稱它的名。

sentences.english: 9 the moon and stars to govern the night; His love endures forever.
sentences.chinese: 他造月亮星宿管黑夜，因他的慈愛永遠長存。

sentences.english: Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; yea, the stars are not pure in his sight.
sentences.chinese: 在神眼前，月亮也無光亮，星宿也不清潔。

sentences.english: He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by [their] names.
sentences.chinese: 他數點星宿的數目，一一稱它的名。

definition: the twenty-eight constellations
Ursa Major/Great Bear/Big Dipper
stars
Qixing district of Guilin city 桂林市[Gui4 lin2 shi4], Guangxi
Chinese constellations
aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
see 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2]
astrology and physiognomy
the ecliptic (the plane of the solar system)
the seven planets of premodern astronomy (the Sun, the Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn)
sun, moon and the five visible planets

four divisions (of the twenty-eight constellations 二十八宿[er4 shi2 ba1 xiu4] of the sky into groups of seven mansions), namely: Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2], White Tiger 白虎[Bai2 hu3], Vermilion Bird 朱雀[Zhu1 que4], Black Tortoise 玄武[Xuan2 wu3]
the sun and moon/day and month/every day and every month/season/life and livelihood
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)

the twelve equatorial constellations or signs of the zodiac in Western astronomy and astrology, namely: Aries 白羊[Bai2 yang2], Taurus 金牛[Jin4 niu2], Gemini 雙子|双子[Shuang1 zi3], Cancer 巨蟹[Ju4 xie4], Leo 獅子|狮子[Shi1 zi3], Virgo 室女[Shi4 nu:3], Libra 天秤[Tian1 cheng4], Scorpio 天蠍|天蝎[Tian1 xie1], Sagittarius 人馬|人马[Ren2 ma3], Capricorn 摩羯[Mo2 jie2], Aquarius 寶瓶|宝瓶[Bao3 ping2], Pisces 雙魚|双鱼[Shuang1 yu2]

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
